title: Afghanistan Internet Blackout Halts Tehran Dollar Channels
description: WANA (Sep 30) – Yesterday afternoon, as Afghanistan experienced a nationwide internet blackout, Tehran’s currency market faced an unexpected development. The popular Telegram channels known as “Tehran Dollar,” which usually publish real-time exchange rates, suddenly stopped updating, leaving their l...

title: Photos: Afghan returnees struggle amid economic and climate crises
description:
Herat, Afghanistan – At the Islam Qala border, the relentless wind carries stinging dust that clings to skin as temperatures soar to 40 degrees Celsius (104 degrees Fahrenheit), transforming the ground into a scorching furnace.

Families huddle in narrow strips of shade, children protecting their fa...

title: HARD NUMBERS: Nigerian docs strike, UN closes aid centers in Afghanistan, Russia cuts rates, Ebola emerges again in Congo.
description:
A large union of Nigerian resident doctors began a five-day strike on Friday over unpaid wages and benefits. The working conditions of medical professionals has been a frequent issue in Africa’s most populous country. In July, there was a mass strike of nurses.
